Quick search

Enter search terms or a module, class or function name.

BandwidthService¶

public class BandwidthService¶

Methods¶

buildBandwidthAvailabilityMap¶

public Map<String, Map<String, Integer>> buildBandwidthAvailabilityMap(List<ReservedBandwidthE> rsvBandwidths)¶

Build a map of the available bandwidth at each URN. For each URN, there is a map of “Ingress” and “Egress” bandwidth available. Only port URNs can be found in this map.

Parameters:
  • rsvBandwidths –
    • A list of all bandwidth reserved so far
Returns:

A mapping of URN to Ingress/Egress bandwidth availability

buildBandwidthAvailabilityMapUrn¶

public Map<String, Integer> buildBandwidthAvailabilityMapUrn(String urn, ReservableBandwidthE bandwidth, Map<String, List<ReservedBandwidthE>> resvBwMap)¶

Determine how much Ingress/Egress bandwidth is still available at a URN. If the list of reserved bandwidths is empty, then all of the Reservable Bandwidth at that URN is available. Otherwise, subtract the sum Ingress/Egress bandwidth from the maximum reservable bandwidth at that URN.

Parameters:
  • bandwidth –
    • ReservableBandwidthE object, which contains the maximum Ingress/Egress bandwidth for a given URN
  • resvBwMap –
    • A Mapping from a URN to a list of Reserved Bandwidths at that URN.
Returns:

A map containing the net available ingress/egress bandwidth at a URN

buildBandwidthAvailabilityMapWithUrns¶

public Map<String, Map<String, Integer>> buildBandwidthAvailabilityMapWithUrns(List<ReservedBandwidthE> rsvBandwidths, List<UrnE> urns)¶

Build a map of the available bandwidth at each URN. For each URN, there is a map of “Ingress” and “Egress” bandwidth available. Only port URNs can be found in this map.

Parameters:
  • rsvBandwidths –
    • A list of all bandwidth reserved so far
  • urns –
    • A list of UrnE objects
Returns:

A mapping of URN to Ingress/Egress bandwidth availability

buildRequestedBandwidthMap¶

public Map<TopoVertex, Map<String, Integer>> buildRequestedBandwidthMap(List<List<TopoEdge>> EROs, List<Integer> bandwidths)¶

Build a map of the requested bandwidth at each port TopoVertex contained within the passed in EROs

Parameters:
  • EROs –
    • List of paths
  • bandwidths –
    • List of bandwidths
Returns:

A mapping from TopoVertex (ports only) to requested “Ingress” and “Egress” bandwidth

buildReservedBandwidthMap¶

public Map<String, List<ReservedBandwidthE>> buildReservedBandwidthMap(List<ReservedBandwidthE> rsvBwList)¶

Build a mapping of UrnE objects to ReservedBandwidthE objects.

Parameters:
  • rsvBwList – A list of all bandwidth reserved.
Returns:

A map of UrnE to ReservedBandwidthE objects

createReservedBandwidthList¶

public List<ReservedBandwidthE> createReservedBandwidthList(Set<ReservedVlanJunctionE> reservedJunctions, Set<ReservedMplsPipeE> reservedMplsPipes, Set<ReservedEthPipeE> reservedEthPipes, Date start, Date end)¶

Given a set of reserved junctions and reserved MPLS / ETHERNET pipes, extract the reserved bandwidth objects which fall within the requested schedule period and return them all together as a list

Parameters:
  • reservedJunctions –
    • Set of reserved ethernet junctions
  • reservedMplsPipes –
    • Set of reserved MPLS pipes
  • reservedEthPipes –
    • Set of reserved Ethernet pipes
  • start –
    • The requested start date
  • end –
    • The requested end date
Returns:

List of all reserved bandwidth contained within reserved pipes and the reserved repository.

evaluateBandwidthEROBi¶

public boolean evaluateBandwidthEROBi(Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, Integer azMbps, Integer zaMbps, List<TopoEdge> azERO, List<TopoEdge> zaERO, Map<String, Map<String, Integer>> availBwMap)¶

Examine all AZ and ZA edges, confirm that the requested bandwidth can be supported given the available bandwidth.

Parameters:
  • urnMap –
    • A map of URN string to URN objects
  • azERO –
    • The path in the A->Z direction
  • zaERO –
    • The path in the Z->A direction
  • availBwMap –
    • A map of bandwidth availability
Returns:

True, if there is sufficient bandwidth across all edges. False, otherwise.

evaluateBandwidthEROUni¶

public boolean evaluateBandwidthEROUni(List<TopoEdge> ERO, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, Map<String, Map<String, Integer>> availBwMap, Integer bwMbps)¶

Given a list of edges, confirm that there is sufficient bandwidth available in the one direction

Parameters:
  • ERO –
    • A series of edges
  • urnMap –
    • A mapping of URN strings to URN objects
  • availBwMap –
    • A mapping of URN objects to lists of reserved bandwidth for that URN
  • bwMbps –
    • The bandwidth in the specified direction
Returns:

True, if the segment can support the requested bandwidth. False, otherwise.

evaluateBandwidthEdge¶

public boolean evaluateBandwidthEdge(TopoEdge edge, Integer azBw, Integer zaBw, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, Map<String, Map<String, Integer>> availBwMap)¶

Evaluate an edge to determine if the nodes on either end of the edge support the requested az and za bandwidths. An edge will only fail the test if one or both URNs (corresponding to the nodes): (1) have valid reservable bandwidth fields, and (2) the URN(s) do not have sufficient available bandwidth available in both the az and za directions (egress and ingress).

Parameters:
  • edge –
    • The edge to be evaluated.
  • azBw –
    • The requested bandwidth in one direction.
  • zaBw –
    • The requested bandwidth in the other direction.
  • urnMap –
    • Map of URN name to UrnE object.
  • availBwMap –
    • Map of UrnE objects to “Ingress” and “Egress” Available Bandwidth
Returns:

True if there is sufficient reservable bandwidth, False otherwise.

evaluateBandwidthEdgeUni¶

public boolean evaluateBandwidthEdgeUni(TopoEdge edge, Integer theBw, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, Map<String, Map<String, Integer>> availBwMap)¶

Evaluate an edge to determine if the nodes on either end of the edge support the requested unidriectional bandwidth. An edge will only fail the test if one or both URNs (corresponding to the nodes): (1) have valid reservable bandwidth fields, and (2) the URN(s) do not have sufficient available bandwidth available in the unique direction.

Parameters:
  • edge –
    • The edge to be evaluated.
  • theBw –
    • The requested bandwidth in one direction.
  • urnMap –
    • Map of URN name to UrnE object.
  • availBwMap –
    • Map of UrnE objects to “Ingress” and “Egress” Available Bandwidth
Returns:

True if there is sufficient reservable bandwidth, False otherwise.

evaluateBandwidthJunction¶

public boolean evaluateBandwidthJunction(RequestedVlanJunctionE req_j, List<ReservedBandwidthE> reservedBandwidths)¶

Confirm that a requested VLAN junction supports the requested bandwidth. Checks each fixture of the junction.

Parameters:
  • req_j –
    • The requested junction.
  • reservedBandwidths –
    • The reserved bandwidth.
Returns:

True, if there is enough bandwidth at every fixture. False, otherwise.

evaluateBandwidthSharedURN¶

public boolean evaluateBandwidthSharedURN(String urn, Map<String, Map<String, Integer>> availBwMap, Integer inMbpsAZ, Integer egMbpsAZ, Integer inMbpsZA, Integer egMbpsZA)¶

Given a specific URN, which is traversed in the same direction by the forward and reverse path, determine if there is enough bandwidth available to support the requested bandwidth

Parameters:
  • urn –
    • The URN
  • availBwMap –
    • Map of URNs to available Bandwidth
  • inMbpsAZ –
    • Requested ingress Mbps in the A->Z direction
  • egMbpsAZ –
    • Requested egress Mbps in the A->Z direction
  • inMbpsZA –
    • Requested ingress Mbps in the Z->A direction
  • egMbpsZA –
    • Requested egress Mbps in the Z->A direction
Returns:

True, if there is enough available bandwidth at the URN. False, otherwise

evaluateBandwidthURN¶

public boolean evaluateBandwidthURN(String urn, Map<String, Map<String, Integer>> availBwMap, Integer inMbps, Integer egMbps)¶

Given a specific URN, determine if there is enough bandwidth available to support the requested bandwidth

Parameters:
  • urn –
    • The URN
  • availBwMap –
    • Map of URNs to available Bandwidth
  • inMbps –
    • Requested ingress Mbps
  • egMbps –
    • Requested egress Mbps
Returns:

True, if there is enough available bandwidth at the URN. False, otherwise

getReservedBandwidthFromRepo¶

public List<ReservedBandwidthE> getReservedBandwidthFromRepo(Date start, Date end)¶

Get a list of all bandwidth reserved between a start and end date/time.

Parameters:
  • start –
    • The start of the time range
  • end –
    • The end of the time range
Returns:

A list of reserved bandwidth

getReservedBandwidthsFromEthPipes¶

public List<ReservedBandwidthE> getReservedBandwidthsFromEthPipes(Set<ReservedEthPipeE> reservedPipes)¶

Retrieve all Reserved Bandwidth from a set of reserved Ethernet pipes.

Parameters:
  • reservedPipes –
    • Set of reserved pipes
Returns:

A list of all reserved bandwidth within the set of reserved Ethernet pipes.

getReservedBandwidthsFromJunctions¶

Retrieve all reserved bandwidths from a set of reserved junctions.

Parameters:
  • junctions –
    • Set of reserved junctions.
Returns:

A list of all bandwidth reserved at those junctions.
